grahampaige.comment:
Yes.  Okay, if each of you could please enter your votes into the chat. It looks like Dave's gone ahead and done that. Dr. Acuff has entered her vote. Ms. Lee has voted. So that means we have six people voting "yes". Our motion carries. Are there any comments for tonight's closed session?
matthewhaas: Mr. Page, could you call the roll again so everybody knows whether they've actually voted or not because some of them didn't see the comment in the chat.
jonnoalcaro: Sorry, my apologies. I forgot to click Enter. My bad. I'm sorry about that. And Katrina?
katrinacallsen: Yeah, I did forget to put it in too. Oh yeah, thanks.
unknownspeaker: Hello, John O. Alcaro, yes. Katrina Kolcu Gelsin, yes. Ellen Osborne, yes. Dave Goldberg, yes. Judith Lee, yes. Graham Page, yes.
kateacuff: I apologize, but I made another mistake earlier today. I accidentally signed off after our work session. But I'd just like to say thank you so much for a very productive evening. Have a good night. Goodnight. Thank you. Thanks. Thank you. Goodnight, everyone. Thank you. Goodnight. Thank you. All right, so we are adjourned from our special session. We will go back into our regular session. Right now is our closed session per Section 2.23711A of the Virginia Code for the discussion and consideration of personnel. Is there a motion to move into closed session?
ellenosborne: Move that we go into closed session according to Virginia code section blah blah blah
jonnoalcaro: Second.  Moved by Mrs. Osborn seconded by Mr. Alcaro that we go into closed session per Virginia Code Section 2.23711 A for the discussion and consideration of personnel matters. Ms. Johnston, could you please take the roll?
unknownspeaker: Jono Alcaro? Yes. Kat Carlson-Gelin? Yes. Ellen Osborne? Yes. Dave Goldberg? Yes. Judith Lee? Yes
